thread.title: Watch UMass coach Mark Whipple discuss injuries to defensive starters, Toledo's killer running game (video)
thread.title_full: Watch UMass coach Mark Whipple discuss injuries to defensive starters, Toledo's killer running game (video)

author: Daniel Malone | Special to MassLive
title: Watch UMass coach Mark Whipple discuss injuries to defensive starters, Toledo's killer running game (video)
text:
comments Watch UMass coach Mark Whipple discuss injuries to defensive starters, Toledo's killer running game (video) 
AMHERST â€“ As the University of Massachusetts football team prepares for what figures to be its toughest home game of the season against No. 19 Toledo Saturday, the Minutemen are without a couple key defensive starters in practice. 
Wednesday night, defensive end Trey Seals and cornerback Kelton Brackett both sat out practice with undisclosed injuries. 
For Seals, it was the second straight day of missed activity. Brackett previously missed time with a knee injury. 
According to coach Mark Whipple, who's been predictably mum on his team's injury situations unless they involve season-ending consequences, said it's "too early" to know if either player will be ready to suit up against the Rockets. 
Whipple did, however, reiterate that he's not the type of coach that'll set a deadline for practice time and hold a player out of a game if he misses too many reps. If either Brackett or Seals can give the team even just a few snaps Saturday, Whipple will have them ready to contribute in limited roles. 
Whipple also touched on a number of other topics in his post-practice interview Wednesday, including Toledo's super-efficient running game and his own defense's lack of turnovers. 
Check out the above video for Whipple's complete commentary. 
Follow MassLive.com UMass beat writer @Daniel_Malone on Twitter or reach him via email .
